column2: Tip awoke soon after dawn, but the Scarecrow had already risen and plucked, with his clumsy fingers, a double-handful of ripe berries from some bushes near by.
column3: Tip awoke soon after dawn, but the Scarecrow had already risen and plucked, with his clumsy fingers, a double handful of ripe berries from some bushes near by.

column2: These the boy ate greedily, finding them an ample breakfast, and afterward the little party resumed its Journey.
column3: These the boy ate greedily, finding them an ample breakfast, and afterward the little party resumed its Journey.

column2: Is the Tin Woodman the Emperor of the Winkies?" asked the horse.
column3: Is the Tin Woodman the Emperor of the Winkies?" asked the horse.

column2: Yes, indeed.	Yes, indeed.
I thought that 'Emperor' was the title of a person who rules an empire, said Tip, "and the Country of the Winkies is only a Kingdom."
column3: I thought that 'Emperor' was the title of a person who rules an empire, said Tip, "and the Country of the Winkies is only a Kingdom."

column2: Don't mention that to the Tin Woodman! exclaimed the Scarecrow, earnestly. "You would hurt his feelings terribly.
column3: Don't mention that to the Tin Woodman! exclaimed the Scarecrow, earnestly. "You would hurt his feelings terribly.

column2: He is a proud man, as he has every reason to be, and it pleases him to be termed Emperor rather than King."
column3: He is a proud man, as he has every reason to be, and it pleases him to be termed Emperor rather than King."

column2: I'm sure it makes no difference to me, replied the boy.
column3: I'm sure it makes no difference to me, replied the boy.

column2: The Saw-Horse now ambled forward at a pace so fast that its riders had hard work to stick upon its back; so there was little further conversation until they drew up beside the palace steps.
column3: The Saw Horse now ambled forward at a pace so fast that its riders had hard work to stick upon its back; so there was little further conversation until they drew up beside the palace steps.

column2: Said the Scarecrow to his personage:
column3: Said the Scarecrow to his personage:

column2: Show us at once to your master, the Emperor.
column3: Show us at once to your master, the Emperor.

column2: How is that? enquired the Scarecrow, anxiously." I hope nothing has happened to him."
column3: How is that? enquired the Scarecrow, anxiously." I hope nothing has happened to him."

column2: Oh, no; nothing serious, returned the man.
column3: Oh, no; nothing serious, returned the man.

column2: But this is his Majesty's day for being polished; and just now his august presence is thickly smeared with putz-pomade.
column3: But this is his Majesty's day for being polished; and just now his august presence is thickly smeared with putz pomade.

column2: My friend was ever inclined to be a dandy, and I suppose he is now more proud than ever of his personal appearance.
column3: My friend was ever inclined to be a dandy, and I suppose he is now more proud than ever of his personal appearance.

column2: He is, indeed, said the man, with a polite bow.
column3: He is, indeed, said the man, with a polite bow.

column2: Good Gracious! the Scarecrow exclaimed at hearing this.
column3: Good Gracious! the Scarecrow exclaimed at hearing this.

column2: If his wit bears the same polish, how sparkling it must be!	If his wit bears the same polish, how sparkling it must be!

The travelers were at first somewhat awed by their surroundings, and even the Scarecrow seemed impressed as he examined the rich hangings of silver cloth caught up into knots and fastened with tiny silver axes.
column3: The travelers were at first somewhat awed by their surroundings, and even the Scarecrow seemed impressed as he examined the rich hangings of silver cloth caught up into knots and fastened with tiny silver axes.

column2: Upon a handsome center-table stood a large silver oil-can, richly engraved with scenes from the past adventures of the Tin Woodman, Dorothy, the Cowardly Lion and the Scarecrow: the lines of the engraving being traced upon the silver in yellow gold.
column3: Upon a handsome center table stood a large silver oil can, richly engraved with scenes from the past adventures of the Tin Woodman, Dorothy, the Cowardly Lion and the Scarecrow: the lines of the engraving being traced upon the silver in yellow gold.

column2: Well! well!	Well! well!
And then the door burst open and Nick Chopper rushed into their midst and caught the Scarecrow in a close and loving embrace that creased him into many folds and wrinkles.
column3: And then the door burst open and Nick Chopper rushed into their midst and caught the Scarecrow in a close and loving embrace that creased him into many folds and wrinkles.

column2: My dear old friend!	My dear old friend!

But, alas! the face of the Scarecrow and many portions of his body bore great blotches of putz-pomade; for the Tin Woodman, in his eagerness to welcome his friend, had quite forgotten the condition of his toilet and had rubbed the thick coating of paste from his own body to that of his comrade.
column3: But, alas! the face of the Scarecrow and many portions of his body bore great blotches of putz pomade; for the Tin Woodman, in his eagerness to welcome his friend, had quite forgotten the condition of his toilet and had rubbed the thick coating of paste from his own body to that of his comrade.

column2: Dear me! said the Scarecrow dolefully.
column3: Dear me! said the Scarecrow dolefully.

column2: But tell me, how came your Majesty here?	But tell me, how came your Majesty here?
and who are your companions?"
column3: and who are your companions?"

column2: The Scarecrow, with great politeness, introduced Tip and Jack Pumpkinhead, and the latter personage seemed to interest the Tin Woodman greatly.
column3: The Scarecrow, with great politeness, introduced Tip and Jack Pumpkinhead, and the latter personage seemed to interest the Tin Woodman greatly.

column2: You are not very substantial, I must admit, said the Emperor.
column3: You are not very substantial, I must admit, said the Emperor.

column2: I hope you are enjoying good health? continued the Woodman.
column3: I hope you are enjoying good health? continued the Woodman.

column2: At present, yes; replied the Pumpkinhead, with a sigh; "but I am in constant terror of the day when I shall spoil."
column3: At present, yes; replied the Pumpkinhead, with a sigh; "but I am in constant terror of the day when I shall spoil."

column2: Nonsense! said the Emperor--but in a kindly, sympathetic tone.
column3: Nonsense! said the Emperor-but in a kindly, sympathetic tone.

column2: Do not, I beg of you, dampen today's sun with the showers of tomorrow.	Do not, I beg of you, dampen today's sun with the showers of tomorrow.
For before your head has time to spoil you can have it canned, and in that way it may be preserved indefinitely."
column3: For before your head has time to spoil you can have it canned, and in that way it may be preserved indefinitely."

column2: He rattled and clanked a little, as he moved, but in the main he seemed to be most cleverly constructed, and his appearance was only marred by the thick coating of polishing-paste that covered him from head to foot.
column3: He rattled and clanked a little, as he moved, but in the main he seemed to be most cleverly constructed, and his appearance was only marred by the thick coating of polishing paste that covered him from head to foot.

column2: The boy's intent gaze caused the Tin Woodman to remember that he was not in the most presentable condition, so he begged his friends to excuse him while he retired to his private apartment and allowed his servants to polish him. This was accomplished in a short time, and when the emperor returned his nickel-plated body shone so magnificently that the Scarecrow heartily congratulated him on his improved appearance.
column3: The boy's intent gaze caused the Tin Woodman to remember that he was not in the most presentable condition, so he begged his friends to excuse him while he retired to his private apartment and allowed his servants to polish him. This was accomplished in a short time, and when the emperor returned his nickel plated body shone so magnificently that the Scarecrow heartily congratulated him on his improved appearance.

column2: That nickel-plate was, I confess, a happy thought, said Nick; "and it was the more necessary because I had become somewhat scratched during my adventurous experiences.
column3: That nickel plate was, I confess, a happy thought, said Nick; "and it was the more necessary because I had become somewhat scratched during my adventurous experiences.

column2: You will observe this engraved star upon my left breast.
column3: You will observe this engraved star upon my left breast.

column2: It is, I am convinced, a strictly orthodox heart, although somewhat larger and warmer than most people possess.
column3: It is, I am convinced, a strictly orthodox heart, although somewhat larger and warmer than most people possess.

column2: Then he turned to the Scarecrow and asked:
column3: Then he turned to the Scarecrow and asked:

column2: Are your subjects happy and contented, my dear friend?
column3: Are your subjects happy and contented, my dear friend?

column2: I cannot, say was the reply.
column3: I cannot, say was the reply.

column2: Great Goodness! cried the Tin Woodman, "What a calamity!
column3: Great Goodness! cried the Tin Woodman, "What a calamity!

column2: What an extraordinary idea!" cried the Emperor, who was both shocked and surprised.
column3: What an extraordinary idea!" cried the Emperor, who was both shocked and surprised.

column2: I was sure you would help me, remarked the Scarecrow in a pleased voice. "How large an army can you assemble?"
column3: I was sure you would help me, remarked the Scarecrow in a pleased voice. "How large an army can you assemble?"

column2: We five, corrected the Pumpkinhead.
column3: We five, corrected the Pumpkinhead.

column2: Five? repeated the Tin Woodman.
column3: Five? repeated the Tin Woodman.

column2: The Tin Woodman looked around him in a puzzled way, for the Saw-Horse had until now remained quietly standing in a corner, where the Emperor had not noticed him.
column3: The Tin Woodman looked around him in a puzzled way, for the Saw Horse had until now remained quietly standing in a corner, where the Emperor had not noticed him.

column2: How came this creature alive?"
column3: How came this creature alive?"

column2: I did it with a magic powder, modestly asserted the boy.
column3: I did it with a magic powder, modestly asserted the boy.

column2: He enabled us to escape the rebels, added the Scarecrow.
column3: He enabled us to escape the rebels, added the Scarecrow.

column2: A live Saw-Horse is a distinct novelty, and should prove an interesting study.	A live Saw Horse is a distinct novelty, and should prove an interesting study.
Does he know anything?"
column3: Does he know anything?"

column2: Well, I cannot claim any great experience in life, the Saw-Horse answered for himself.
column3: Well, I cannot claim any great experience in life, the Saw Horse answered for himself.

column2: Perhaps you do, said the emperor; "for experience does not always mean wisdom.
column3: Perhaps you do, said the emperor; "for experience does not always mean wisdom.

column2: But time is precious Just now, so let us quickly make preparations to start upon our Journey.
column3: But time is precious Just now, so let us quickly make preparations to start upon our Journey.

column2: Meanwhile the Scarecrow was taken apart and the painted sack that served him for a head was carefully laundered and restuffed with the brains originally given him by the great Wizard.
column3: Meanwhile the Scarecrow was taken apart and the painted sack that served him for a head was carefully laundered and restuffed with the brains originally given him by the great Wizard.

column2: His clothes were also cleaned and pressed by the Imperial tailors, and his crown polished and again sewed upon his head, for the Tin Woodman insisted he should not renounce this badge of royalty.
column3: His clothes were also cleaned and pressed by the Imperial tailors, and his crown polished and again sewed upon his head, for the Tin Woodman insisted he should not renounce this badge of royalty.

column2: The Scarecrow now presented a very respectable appearance, and although in no way addicted to vanity he
column3: The Scarecrow now presented a very respectable appearance, and although in no way addicted to vanity he

column2: While this was being done Tip mended the wooden limbs of Jack Pumpkinhead and made them stronger than before, and the Saw-Horse was also inspected to see if he was in good working order.
column3: While this was being done Tip mended the wooden limbs of Jack Pumpkinhead and made them stronger than before, and the Saw Horse was also inspected to see if he was in good working order.
